resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: ZKFC should use getAversion() while setting the zkacl

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
On clusters where NN HA is enabled zookeper ACLs need to be handled consistently when enabling security.

The current behavior is as follows:
* if HA is enabled before the cluster is made secure, proper ACLs are only set on the leaf znodes, while there's no ACLs set on the path (eg.:/hadoop-ha/mycluster/ActiveStandbyElectorLock)
* if HA is enabled after the cluster is made secure ACLs are set on the root znode as well
fields.summary: Zookeper ACLs on NN HA enabled clusters to be handled consistently

Thank you [~arpitagarwal] for guiding me on this.

Patch v01 has the following changes
* setAcl on Parent zNodes is attempted with retries, similar to other zk actions.
* moved and changed unit test.
